thread.title: Sam’s Club Aims to Be Less Like Wal-Mart
thread.title_full: Sam’s Club Aims to Be Less Like Wal-Mart

title: Sam’s Club Aims to Be Less Like Wal-Mart
text:
Sarah.Nassauer@wsj.com Aug. 16, 2015 3:54 p.m. ET 
After struggling for years to turn around sluggish sales, Sam’s Club is now pursuing a more fundamental fix: breaking away from the low-income consumers who shop at at its parent, Wal-Mart Stores Inc. 
“We want to be less of a Wal-Mart,” said Rosalind Brewer, chief executive of the warehouse-club retailer that has tried more modest moves like improving online ordering and adding such services as tax preparation that appeal to... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Popular on WSJ
